info.name: Snappcoin API Documentation
info.description:
The Snappcoin API Documentation provides comprehensive information and guidelines for developers and users interested in integrating with the Snappcoin platform. Snappcoin is a digital currency and rewards system that enhances the gaming and shopping experience for users, gamers, vendors, and merchants.

**Sections**

**1.Gamer Module** :

The Gamer Module is designed to facilitate the management of gamers' accounts and interactions within the Snappcoin ecosystem. This section contains a list of APIs with multiple CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) requests to manage gamer profiles, preferences, and rewards. Developers can leverage these APIs to create, retrieve, update, and delete gamer accounts, track gaming activity, and award Snapp Coins to gamers as reward by winning the games.This section is essential for managing gamer-related data and enhancing their overall experience like reviewing their status of the products they redeemed.

To access the gamer module [click here.](https://cloudy-crescent-153556.postman.co/workspace/Snapcoins~78ee7e86-b0f0-46c2-bbed-e5ff1ebb2d8d/folder/29605817-a7b2db86-7774-4119-a5b8-abe9254069a0?ctx=documentation)

2.**Gamer-Vendor Module :**

The Gamer-Vendor Module bridges the gap between gamers and vendors, enabling seamless transactions and interactions. This section encompasses APIs that facilitate vendor registration, product listings, and order management. Vendors can create accounts, list gaming services, and process orders efficiently. Gamers can explore vendor offering games , win Snappcoins. The Gamer-Vendor Module fosters collaboration between gamers and vendors, making it a vital component of the Snappcoin ecosystem.

To access the gamer-vendor module [click here.](https://cloudy-crescent-153556.postman.co/workspace/Snapcoins~78ee7e86-b0f0-46c2-bbed-e5ff1ebb2d8d/folder/29605817-9fb1b20c-5cb0-458a-9df4-eaede6826c34?ctx=documentation)

3.**Merchant Module**:

The Merchant Module is tailored for businesses and service providers seeking to participate in the Snappcoin network. This section presents APIs that empower merchants to register, verify their identities, and manage transactions. With Snappcoin platform , merchants can accept Snapp coins as a form of payment, access transaction histories, and engage with a wider audience of gamers and shoppers. This module simplifies the integration process for merchants and enhances their accessibility to Snappcoin users.

4.**General Module:**

The General Module covers foundational APIs and features that benefit all participants in the Snappcoin ecosystem. This section includes authentication and authorization mechanisms, error handling guidelines, and best practices for data security. Developers and users will find valuable information on how to securely interact with Snappcoin, troubleshoot common issues, and ensure a smooth experience while using the platform.

Whether you are a gamer, vendor, merchant, or developer, the Snap Coin API Documentation provides a comprehensive resource to help you navigate and leverage the full potential of the Snappcoin ecosystem. Each module is tailored to meet the specific needs of its users, ensuring a seamless and rewarding experience for all.

item.name: GAMER MODULE
User Authentication API

request.description:
Description: Allows users to register for a new account by providing their username, email address, password, and password confirmation. Upon successful registration, the user is added to the system.

  
THIS IS A JSON RESPONSE EXAMPLE AFTER SENDING A REQUEST WITH THE USER CREDENTIALS.

THE BELOW IS THE BODY CONTENT
Allows users to authenticate by providing their username and password. If the credentials are valid, the user receives an authentication token to access protected resources.
This url endpoint provide an otp to the login user's registered email
This url endpoint verifys the otp entered by user with the generated one.And upon successfull verfication the user will will be finally verified

item.description:
OVERVIEW:
The User Authentication API provides endpoints for user registration and login. It allows users to create new accounts and authenticate themselves to access protected resources. It also provides endpoints to generate OTP and verify the sent OTP on the user email.

item.name: cart api

request.description:
**HEADER**: Non AUthorization

The Endpoint expects three paramerters into the query those are:

**Variable** -------------------- **Type**  
uid(USER ID of the gamer) - string,

name(Name of item that gamer added into the cart) - string,

price(price of the item) - integer

The below are the params and it's values:

query.description: USER NAME OF THE GAMER (TYPE - string)
Name of the item that gamer added into cart(TYPE - string)

request.description:
HEADER: No AUTHORIZATION

This get method displays gamers items list in his cart in json format which includes :

Name of the item

Price of the item

Quantity of the item

Id of the item

The below were taken parameters for this query :

HEADER:No AUTHORIZATION.

This post method deletes the item int gamers cart.

The expected parameters to pass on to query were:

| **key** | Type | Desciption |
| --- | --- | --- |
| uid | string | This the user id of the gamer to remove the item |
| itemid | string | this id of item that need to be removed |

This post method provides a method to update the number of items that the respective gamer wants to change in his cart.

The expected parameters were:

| key | Type | **state** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| uid | string | require | we need to provide user id of gamer |
| num | integer | require | numeber to add to quantity of items. |
| itemid | string | require | item id of the resoective gamer id |

About the "num" parameter the value of the that key will add to quantity default value.If it is positive the quantity will update as default value+given value.If the number is negative,the quantity will reduce

item.description: The curd methods this API provides were mainly on how to add an item into the gamer's account.Upon adding a new item there is a delete method to remove the item from the gamer's cart list.Furthermore,this API provides the method to display the gamer's cart list in an ordered list and developer can get to know the changing number of items that gamer added into his/her cart.

item.description:
This is the first module that provies API's for developers to manage the gamers accounts and payment gateways.

Briefly, there were seven API's that have different type of roles to play.

User Aunthentication : This API provides a guide on how a gamer can register by providing particular credentials.After sign up therea re further steps like login and generating otp and last but not the least verfying gamer that concludes his sucessfull creation of his/her snap coin account.

item.name: GAMING-VENDOR MODULE
GV-Profile Management
Authorization

item.description: This router offers various methods, including POST and GET, to facilitate the successful registration of vendors within the SnappCoin app. Upon logging into their accounts, vendors will receive an authentication token, enhancing their access and security.

item.name: GV-settings

variable.description: A unique ID that belongs to the vendor

request.description:
HEADER:

| Key | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Accept-Encoding | gzip,deflate,br |
| Cookie | token |

Retrieve account settings for a specific vendor identified by their vendor_id.

Here vendor_id is given as path variable.

| **key** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| vendor_id | string | Unique Id to specify vendor's identity |

**RESULT**: The API returns the status of the following variables :

| **key** | **Description** | **Type** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| reminders | Sends notifications to the vendor's registered email address, whether it's an Email or Hotmail account, whenever their wallet balance is about to be depleted | Boolean |
| promote | Any promotions from vendor | Boolean |
| Profile_temp_disable | Whether vendor wants to disable his profile or not | Boolean |
| newletter | Product details | Boolean |

**Headers:**

| **key** | **Value** |
| --- | --- |
| Content-Type | application/json |
| Accept-Encoding | gzip,deflate,br |
| Cookie | token |

This **POST** method provides the function to change the settings of the vendor.

Body parameters:

| **key** | **Description** | **Type** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| vendor_id | Unique Id of the vendor | string |
| reminders | sends notification to registered Email or Hotmail whenever,the vendor was going to run out of his wallet funds. | Boolean |
| promote | Any promotions from vendor side | Boolean |
| Profile_temp_disable | Whether vendor wants to disable his profile or not | Boolean |
| newsletter | Product Details | Boolean |

**RESULT**:

| **HTTP STATUS** | **RESULT/OUTPUT** |
| --- | --- |
| 200 | Receives a list of JSON about the body parameters as shown in response right side. |
| 404 | { message: "Vendor not found" } |

Below is an example of Body (JSON)

response.name: Example_1
response.body:
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Account settings updated successfully",
    "reminders": true,
    "promote": true,
    "profile_temp_disable": false,
    "newsletter": false
}

The Below is an example of query paramters:

item.description: The Vendor Account Settings API router empowers game vendors within the SnappCoins ecosystem to have fine-grained control over their account preferences and customization options. This router provides methods such as POST and GET to facilitate operations related to account settings and security

This API comprises two essential methods: "Vendor Authorization" and "Vendor Details." Its primary objective is to facilitate the smooth registration of vendors within the SnappCoin app, ensuring seamless login and registration processes. Furthermore, the API offers configurable parameters that empower vendors with greater flexibility. They can customize game types, specify the number of coins awarded to game winners, and receive notifications when their Snappcoin wallet balance is low

item.name: GV-Snappcoin Interface
Wallet

request.description:
**HEADER**: | **Key** | **Value** | | --- | --- | | Accept-Encoding | gzip,deflate,br | | | | This GET method provides vendor to know the number of snappcoins in thier wallet by providing thier ID as path varaible. VendorId as path variable: RESULT/RESPONSE: | **HTTP STATUS** | **OUTPUT** | | --- | --- | | 200 | {
"vendor_name": vendor_name(string),
"vendor_coins": vendor_coins(count)
} | | 401 | {
error: "Vendor does not exist. Check Vendor Id."
} | | 500 | {
error: "Failed to retrieve vendor"
} |

response.name: Bad Response

request.description:
**HEADER**: | **Key** | **Value** | | --- | --- | | Content-Type | application/json | | Accept-Encoding | gzip,deflate,br | | | | This POST method provides vendor to purchase the tokens that can be exchanged to Snappcoins from Snappcoin app by giving these body parameters: | **key** | **Type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | vendor_id | string | A unique ID given to vendor | | tokens_ToPurchase | string | number to exchange with snappcoins | | paymentStatus | string | Status of payment | RESULT: | **HTTP STATUS** | **OUTPUT** | | --- | --- | | 200 | {
"success": true,
"message": "Snappcoins purchased successfully"
} | | 400 | { error: "Payment failed" } | | 401 | { error: "Vendor does not exist. Check Vendor Id." } | The below is example of BODY JSON

**HEADER**:

| **Key** | **Value** |
| --- | --- |
| Content-Type | application/json |
| Accept-Encoding | gzip,deflate,br |
| Authorization |  |

This POST method allows the vendor to allocate the coins to the gamer as the gamer clicks the redeem button.

The Body parameters are:

| **Key** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| vendor_id | string | ID of the vendor |
| vendor_name | string | Name of the company |
| vendor_email | string | registered email |
| gamer_id | string | ID of the gamer |
| gamer_name | string | Name of the gamer |
| tokenToAllocate | Integer | Reward for gamer after winning |

There are TWO cases:

**1.First Case** : When Vendor_coins > TokensToAllocate

**RESULT:**

| **HTTP STATUS** | **OUTPUT** |
| --- | --- |
| 200 | { success: true, message: "Snappcoins allocated successfully" } |
| 401 | { error: "Vendor does not exist. Check Vendor Id." } |

2.SECOND CASE: When Vendor_coins

The vendor would recieve an alert in thier registered Email that conatins an text addressing the problem with the info about the gamer who tries to reedem the coins.

The below is an example of body JSON:

response.name: Bad response

item.description: This API grants vendors access to their Snappcoin wallet details facilitates Snappcoin purchases, displays payment status using the Stripe testing third-party platform, and allows vendors to allocate coins to gamers. Detailed information on each of these functionalities is provided below for inclusion in the API documentation.

item.name: Transactions

request.description:
HEADER: | **Key** | **Value** | | --- | --- | | Accept-Encoding | gzip,deflate,br | | | | This GET method generates the new Transaction ID for the vendor by just running the request. No parameters required. RESULT: | **HTTP STATUS** | OUTPUT | **Explanation** | | --- | --- | --- | | 200 | {
"transactionId": "T-GV-00025"
} | The T(Transaction)-GV(Gamer-vendor)-000XX(This is a five digit number starts with zeroes.
Every time we request a new ID gets generated by incrementing the previous digits. | IF no vendor transactions present before then ID starts from "T-GV-00001"

HEADER: | **Key** | **Value** | | --- | --- | | Content-Type | application/json | | Accept-Encoding | gzip,deflate,br | | Cookie | token | This POST method stores the new transaction generated by the vendor by giving following body parameters: BODY PARAMETERS: | **Key** | **Type** | **required** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | transaction_id | string | true | This is the new generated transaction ID | | vendor_id | string | true | A unique ID given to vendor | | vendor_name | string | true | Name of the company | | transaction_date | Date | true | Time stamp of transaction | | transaction_status | string | true | Status of payment | | snappcoin_count | Number | true | Number of snappcoins | RESULT: | **HTTP STATUS** | **DESCRIPTION** | | --- | --- | | 200 | Recives a list of JSON data that adding transaction was successfull | | 500 | Recieves this JSON data as ouput:
{ error: "Failed to add new transaction" } |

HEADER: | **Key** | **Value** | | --- | --- | | Accept-Encoding | gzip,deflate,br | | Cookie | token | This GET method displays the transaction details by providing the vendor ID and Transaction ID as path variables in the request. RESULT: | **HTTP STATUS** | **OUTPUT** | | --- | --- | | 200 | {
"searchResults": \[
{
"_id": VENDOR_ID,
"transaction_id": "TRANSACTION ID",
"vendor_id": "GV009",
"vendor_name": "COMPANY NAME",
"transaction_date": "TIME STAMP OF THAT DAY",
"transaction_status": "STAUS",
"snappcoin_count": COUNT,
"createdAt": "TIME STAMP ",
"updatedAt": "TIME STAMP",
"__v": 0
} | | 500 | { error: "Failed to retrieve transaction history" } |

HEADER:

| **Key** | **Value** |
| --- | --- |
| Accept-Encoding | application/json |
| Cookie | token |

This GET method displays the all transactions history of the vendor id by providing the vendor_id as path variable

RESULT:

| **HTTP STAUTUS** | **OUTPUT** |
| --- | --- |
| 200 | Recive a list of JSON data decribing about the transaction detalis that were done by |
| 500 | { error: "Failed to retrieve transaction history" } |

item.description: This router empowers vendors to carry out various actions, including checking their transaction history and creating transactions for storage. Additionally, with valid vendor credentials, the API retrieves all transactions associated with that specific vendor.

} | The below is example of Body Json

item.description: This router provides functions for generating unique Allocation IDs for gamers, enabling them to receive Snappcoin allocations from the vendor's wallet. It also grants access to the vendor's allocation history.

This API comprises routers designed to facilitate various operations, including linking the vendor to their Snappcoin wallet, purchasing Snappcoins, and accessing information about the reward allocations to gamers. Additionally, the API integrates with a payment gateway, specifically Stripe, to ensure secure transactions and provide product status updates. Detailed explanations of each method are provided below for your reference in the API documentation

item.name: GV-Snappcoin Bank
snappcoin bank

request.description:
HEADER:

| **Key** | **Value** |
| --- | --- |
| Accept-Encoding | gzip,deflate,br |
| Content-Type | application/json |

This POST method takes the below given body parameters and update them by the new values assigned into the snappcoin data base.

**Body Parameters**:

| **key** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| transaction_id | string | Generated transaction ID |
| transaction_status | string | status |
| transaction_date | Date | Times stamp of transaction |
| user_persona | string | User type |
| vendor_id | string | A unique ID given to vendor |
| snappcoin_purchased | Number | Count of Coins purchased |
| gamer_id | string | ID of gamer |
| gamer_name | string | Name of the gamer |
| merchandise_purchased | string | Product that gamer exchanged for thier wallet coins to merchant products |
| merchant_id | string | ID of merchant |
| merchant_name | string | Merchant name |
| snappcoins_redeemed | Number | Coins exhanged count |

RESULT:

| **HTTP STATUS** | **OUTPUT** |
| --- | --- |
| 201 | {savedTransaction} |
| 500 | { error: "Failed to add transaction" } |

The below is an example of Body:

item.description: This router has one method that fetch the details of the vendor,gamer and merchant's after a transaction had done .In addition this data can be updated into the database of snappcoin bank.
This API allows you to update transaction details within the Snappcoin bank for past transactions.

The Gaming-Vendor (GV) Module APIs are designed to offer vendors within the SnappCoins ecosystem a seamless and user-friendly experience. These APIs cover various aspects, including vendor registration, login, authentication, wallet integration, customization of settings, snappcoin purchase, and snappcoin redemption. Below, we delve into the features of this module in more detail:

**GV-Profile Management:**  
This API encompasses different routes that enable vendors to register, sign in, and verify their accounts. Additionally, it facilitates vendor account settings customization.

**GV-Snappcoin Interface**:  
This API empowers vendors with comprehensive access to their transaction history, allowing them to efficiently manage their snappcoin wallets. Vendors can perform various operations, such as purchasing Snappcoins, allocating Snappcoins to gamers, and more.

**GV-Snappcoin Bank:**  
This API focuses on transactions involving gamers, gamer-vendors, and merchants. It provides operations for updating and viewing these transactions, ensuring seamless interactions within the SnappCoins ecosystem.

Authorization

request.description:
HEADER: | **Key** | **Value** | | --- | --- | | Accept-Encoding | gzip,deflate,br | | Content-Type | application/json | | Authorization | | This POST method provides merchant to register by giving following Body paramters: **Body Parameters**: | **key** | **Description** | **Type** | | --- | --- | --- | | password | Password that satisifies requirements | string | | email
\[**unique\]** | registering Email | string | | phoneNumber
**\[unique\]** | Office number | string | | address | Enter the office address | string | | gender | Gender of the merchant | string | | companyName | Provide Name of the company | string | **Result/Response:** | **HTTP STATUS** | **OUTPUT** | | --- | --- | | 200 | { userId: createuser._id, email, msg: "Registration Successful" } | | 400 | { success: false, msg: "This email is already registered" } | | 400 | { error: "Phone number already exists" } | | 500 | { error: \`Internal server error ${error}\` } | The below is example of body JSON

HEADER: | **Key** | **Value** | | --- | --- | | Content-Type | application/json | | Accept-Encoding | gzip,deflate,br | | Authorization | | This POST login method generates a token after merchant successfully signed into thier account by following parameters: | **key** | **Type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | password | string | Give password that entered during registration | | email | string | Give registered Email | RESULT: | **HTTP STATUS** | **OUTPUT** | | --- | --- | | 200 | Will recieve detils of merchant with a message in JSON that says
{ "Verify your email"} | | 400 | { status: false, msg: "This email is not registered!!" } | | 400 | { status: false, msg: "Password incorrect!!" } | | 500 | { status: false, msg: "Internal Server Error" } | A Token would be generated in the cookies section.

HEADER: | **Key** | **Value** | | --- | --- | | Accept-Encoding | gzip,br,deflate | This POST method generates the otp to merchant's registered email by provinding the user_ID of merchant: RESULT: | **HTTP STATUS** | **OUTPUT** | | --- | --- | | 201 | {
"msg": "Otp Sent"
} | After running this request the merchant recieves a text to "enter this {{otp}} to verify your email" to thier registered email.
